description:
Manual games allow you to set custom check locations and custom item names that will be rolled into a multiworld.
This allows any variety of game -- PC, console, board games, Microsoft Word memes... really anything -- to be part of a multiworld randomizer.
The key component to including these games is some level of manual restriction. Since the items are not actually withheld from the player,
the player must manually refrain from using these gathered items until the tracker shows that they have been acquired or sent.

alpha.description:
This manual is a work in progress and in need of testers. Hence why it is an alpha version.
I know it needs probably better logic.
It lacks Starting Items so I plan to update that with the next update.
Within logical reason you can use starting items and weapons (such as the required vulnerary use in the prologue chapter) but for the most part you're meant to wait for other players to send you items, weapons, skills, equipment, units, and class promotions before being able to use them in a playthrough.

There are 4 different built-in "Victory" points  or "Goals" upon completing chapters 8, 17 (Ike's promotion to Lord), Ch. 27 (defeating the Black Knight), and Endgame (Defeating Ashnard). 
So those victory points will trigger your goal and whatever else you have programmed for your AP. So you can manually select one of those depending on how long you want the playthrough to be. 

Looking forward to your feedback/suggestions and then I'll do my best to improve it over time. Thank you to everyone who has tested this manual APworld so far!

PS: It is recommended to play a new game on a save file that has already finished a play-through. (You don't have to but it will make the Band's you receive via AP items useless) -Note that you will not have checks in your play-through tied to getting the bands as I did not program those as checks. 

Some save game data if you want to pick one that has save data with a cleared playthrough to be able to get the bands in your run: 
[Save Game Files](https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/gamecube/920189-fire-emblem-path-of-radiance/saves)

GOAL: 
Choose to either complete Chapter 8, complete Chapter 17 (Ike Promotion), Chapter 27 (Defeat the BK), or Defeat Ashnard in the Final Chapter (29) 

CHECKS:
Completing a story chapter give you a check.
Any units that join you rewards you with a check per unit.
Every character has a check for their available class change.
Every chest and visitable house has been organized by chapter.
Every Item dropped by a boss or an enemy on a "Rout" victory condition chapter will give a check.

For clarity, when you use the manual:
Ike is considered a starting item.
The trainer weapon is also considered a starting item. (The mandatory vulnerary use that you get from Mist is as well) so you can get through the prologue.
Unfortunately by Chapter 1 if you don't have any of the 4 unit's weapons unlocked you might frequently hit a chapter 1 BK. I'll need to test this further to see how often this happens and what can be done about it. My early thoughts are allow the iron sword to also be a starting item...
Clarification on the "Choose X character" items: This really only applies to Chapter 8 and onwards. The lack of these items in your playthrough does not impact chapters 1-7 because you don't have the option of choosing your units before you start the map. Starting chapter 8+ you will have to have those specific items to allow you to choose more units besides Ike.


Optionally you can also use Lush’s FE Universal Randomizer, “Yune”.
[Yune Randomizer](https://github.com/lushen124/Universal-FE-Randomizer/tree/master?tab=readme-ov-file#fe9)

Any suggestions/changes/feedback/volunteers to test would be greatly appreciated!
alpha.title: v0.1.0-alpha

v0.2.description:
### **V.0.2.1-beta!**

**Changelogs:**

-Corrected the Boss' name in Chapter 4 to the correct name.
-Added a lot more categorization to organize items and checks better.
-Updated logic for Regions based on the 4 optional goals to (hopefully) prevent BKing other players in the AP multiworld behind checks much later in the game. (this needs a lot more testing to see if it works well)
-Added some overlooked items to account for using the Yune Randomizer when using this Manual.
-Removed a significant amount of weapons from the items list and added instead every weapon type's ranks D-S to determine which weapons are usable.
-probably more small updates that I forgot about...

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This manual is a work in progress and in need of testers.
I believe the logic has improved from the Alpha but I have not tested it yet.
It still lacks programmed Starting Items so I'll look into that for the next update.
Within logical reason you can use starting weapons (Ranks E-D). You can also feel free to use the required vulnerary use in the prologue chapter. 
Other than that, for the most part, you're meant to wait for other players to send you items, weapons ranks, skills, equipment, units, and class promotions before being able to use them in a playthrough.

There are 4 different built-in "Victory" points or "Goals" 

**GOAL OPTIONS:**
1. Completing Ch. 8 
2. Ike's promotion to Lord at the end of Ch. 17 
3. Completing Ch. 27 (defeating the Black Knight) 
4. Completing Endgame (Defeating Ashnard)

So those victory points will trigger your goal and whatever else you have programmed for your AP. So you can manually select one of those depending on how long you want the playthrough to be.

PS: It is recommended to play a new game on a save file that has already finished a play-through. (You don't have to but it will make the Band's you receive via AP items useless) -Note that you will not have checks in your play-through tied to getting the bands as I did not program those as checks.

Some save game data if you want to pick one that has save data with a cleared playthrough to be able to get the bands in your run:
[Save Game Files](https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/gamecube/920189-fire-emblem-path-of-radiance/saves)

**CHECKS:**
Completing a story chapter give you a check.
Any units that join you rewards you with a check per unit.
Every character has a check for their available class change.
Every chest and visitable house has been organized by chapter as individual checks.
Every Item dropped by a boss or an enemy on a "Rout" victory condition chapter will give a check.

For clarity, when you use the manual:
Any weapon that is not listed as a receivable item is considered unlocked from the start of the game. You will just need to get the weapon rank "item" from other players in the AP that is required to use the weapon you wish to use. (some late game or unique weapons require receiving them as "items" from other players in order to use them,

I'll need further testing to see how well this works in a playthrough.
 
Clarification on the "Choose X character" items: This really only applies to Chapter 8 and onwards. The lack of these items in your playthrough does not impact chapters 1-7 because you don't have the option of choosing your units before you start the map. Starting chapter 8+ you will have to have those specific items to allow you to choose more units besides Ike.

Optionally you can also use Lush’s FE Universal Randomizer, “Yune”.
[Yune Randomizer](https://github.com/lushen124/Universal-FE-Randomizer/tree/master?tab=readme-ov-file#fe9)

Any suggestions/changes/feedback/volunteers to test would be greatly appreciated!
v0.2.title: Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance Manual APWorld v0.2.1-beta

v0.2.2-beta.description: Small hotfixes to apworld and attempted to reupload the yaml.

v0.2.3-beta.description:
Small update to the manual to remove all basic weapons and instead include each weapon's progressive ranks included as items to receive. This excludes all special or unique weapons as well as Rank E weapons. All rank E Weapons are considered starting items. Each progressive weapon rank enables the use of the next rank in that respective weapon category.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

This manual is a work in progress and in need of testers.
I believe the logic has improved from the Alpha but I have not tested it yet.
It still lacks programmed Starting Items so I'll look into that for the next update.
Within logical reason you can use starting weapons (Ranks E-D). You can also feel free to use the required vulnerary use in the prologue chapter.
Other than that, for the most part, you're meant to wait for other players to send you items, weapons ranks, skills, equipment, units, and class promotions before being able to use them in a playthrough.

There are 4 different built-in "Victory" points or "Goals"

GOAL OPTIONS:

Completing Ch. 8
Ike's promotion to Lord at the end of Ch. 17
Completing Ch. 27 (defeating the Black Knight)
Completing Endgame (Defeating Ashnard)

So those victory points will trigger your goal and whatever else you have programmed for your AP. So you can manually select one of those depending on how long you want the playthrough to be.

PS: It is recommended to play a new game on a save file that has already finished a play-through. (You don't have to but it will make the Band's you receive via AP items useless) -Note that you will not have checks in your play-through tied to getting the bands as I did not program those as checks.

Some save game data if you want to pick one that has save data with a cleared playthrough to be able to get the bands in your run:
[Save Game Files](https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/gamecube/920189-fire-emblem-path-of-radiance/saves)

CHECKS:
Completing a story chapter give you a check.
Any units that join you rewards you with a check per unit.
Every character has a check for their available class change.
Every chest and visitable house has been organized by chapter as individual checks.
Every Item dropped by a boss or an enemy on a "Rout" victory condition chapter will give a check.

For clarity, when you use the manual:
Any weapon that is not listed as a receivable item is considered unlocked from the start of the game. You will just need to get the weapon rank "item" from other players in the AP that is required to use the weapon you wish to use. (some late game or unique weapons require receiving them as "items" from other players in order to use them,

I'll need further testing to see how well this works in a playthrough.

Clarification on the "Choose X character" items: This really only applies to Chapter 8 and onwards. The lack of these items in your playthrough does not impact chapters 1-7 because you don't have the option of choosing your units before you start the map. Starting chapter 8+ you will have to have those specific items to allow you to choose more units besides Ike.

Optionally you can also use Lush’s FE Universal Randomizer, “Yune”.

v0.2.3-beta.title: Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance Manual APWorld v0.2.3-beta

v1.1.0.description:
### **First Official Production Release!!**
There are now 252 Items
And 301 Locations/Checks (Added all items dropped by enemies)
If you are playing on a difficulty where the item is not available you can simply clear the chapter to collect the check manually.

Also I have programmed what should be a SIGNIFICANT improvement to the game's logic. Keep in mind it's still an AP world. The multiworlds will be randomized and you could still experience bad luck. But overall this should drastically improve the experience for those playing the Manual and also the rest of the multiworld's players in the Sync or Async.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance is a 2005 tactical role-playing video game developed by Intelligent Systems and Nintendo SPD, and published by Nintendo for the GameCube. This Manual APworld is for use with the Archipelago randomizer.

It still lacks programmed Starting Items so I'll look into that for a future update.
Within logical reason you can use starting weapons (Ranks E). You can also feel free to use the necessary (vanilla playthrough) vulnerary in the prologue chapter.
Other than that, for the most part, you're meant to wait for other players to send you items, weapons ranks, skills, equipment, units, and class promotions before being able to use them in a playthrough. 
IMPORTANT: Each weapon's progressive ranks are included as items you will need to receive in a multi-world AP before you can use the next ranks. This excludes all special or unique weapons however. Also remember that all rank E Weapons are considered starting items. Each progressive weapon rank enables the use of the next rank in that respective weapon category.

There are 4 different built-in "Victory" points or "Goals"

**GOAL OPTIONS:**

    Completing Ch. 8
    Ike's promotion to Lord at the end of Ch. 17
    Completing Ch. 27 (defeating the Black Knight)
    Completing Endgame (Defeating Ashnard)

So those victory points will trigger your goal and whatever else you have programmed for your AP. So you can manually select one of those depending on how long you want the playthrough to be.

PS: It is recommended to play a new game on a save file that has already finished a play-through. (You don't have to but it will make the Band's you receive via AP items useless). Getting these Bands are checks/locations.

Some save game data if you want to pick one that has save data with a cleared playthrough to be able to get the bands in your run:
[Save Game Files](https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/gamecube/920189-fire-emblem-path-of-radiance/saves)

**CHECKS:**
Completing a story chapter give you a check.
Any units that join you rewards you with a check per unit.
Every character has a check for their available class change.
Every chest and visitable house has been organized by chapter as individual checks.
Every Item dropped by a boss or an enemy will give a check.

For clarity, when you use the manual:
Any weapon that is not listed as a receivable item is considered unlocked from the start of the game.

**IMPORTANT Clarification:** on the "Choose X character" items: This really only applies to Chapter 8 and onwards. The lack of these items in your playthrough does not impact chapters 1-7 because you don't have the option of choosing your units before you start the map. Starting chapter 8+ you will have to have those specific items to allow you to choose more units besides Ike.

Optionally you can also use Lush’s FE Universal Randomizer, “Yune”.
[Yune Randomizer](https://github.com/lushen124/Universal-FE-Randomizer/tree/master?tab=readme-ov-file#fe9)

Any suggestions/changes/feedback would be greatly appreciated!
v1.1.0.title: Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance Manual APWorld v1.1.0

v1.2.0.description:
### **Fine-tuning the Official Production Release:**

1. **Fixed** the "Shinon Joins" check to be categorized in the correct chapter that he actually joins at.

2. **Updated** the Goal Options categorization to make these easier to find.
3. **Updated** all Requirements for every region (chapter) in the game to improve logic consistent with what should be the minimum amount of units needed to complete a chapter and collect all checks present in that level.
4. **Updated** many items from being designated as progressive to "useful" instead to improve experience when receiving progressive items.

5. **Added** the generic template yaml for player customization
6. **Added** a "Defeat Boyd" check to the Prologue 
7. **Added** logic that requires the "Choose Rolf" item to be received before the Recruit Shinon Checks.
8. **Added** better descriptions for Ch. 17 check to distinguish which part the check can be reached in the chapter.
9. **Added** 17 more Master Seals as items to account for the 18 total units that you can potentially use Master Seals on to make 1 per unit necessary. (This limits you to only being able to promote the same number of units as total Master Seals you have received) -The game logic already reflects this so it won't expect you to reach a promotion check unless you have a master seal for it (and the item needed to unlock the unit's specific promotion)
**New total of items is:** 269
10. **Added** all missing checks that corresponds to every boss in the game (some were missing). 
 -This brings the **new total of checks to: 310** 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance is a 2005 tactical role-playing video game developed by Intelligent Systems and Nintendo SPD, and published by Nintendo for the GameCube. This Manual APworld is for use with the Archipelago randomizer.

It still lacks programmed Starting Items so I'll look into that for a future update.
Within logical reason you can use starting weapons (Ranks E). You can also feel free to use the necessary (vanilla playthrough) vulnerary in the prologue chapter.
Other than that, for the most part, you're meant to wait for other players to send you items, weapons ranks, skills, equipment, units, and class promotions before being able to use them in a playthrough. 
IMPORTANT: Each weapon's progressive ranks are included as items you will need to receive in a multi-world AP before you can use the next ranks. This excludes all special or unique weapons however. Also remember that all rank E Weapons are considered starting items. Each progressive weapon rank enables the use of the next rank in that respective weapon category.

There are 4 different built-in "Victory" points or "Goals"

**GOAL OPTIONS:**

    Completing Ch. 8
    Ike's promotion to Lord at the end of Ch. 17
    Completing Ch. 27 (defeating the Black Knight)
    Completing Endgame (Defeating Ashnard)

So those victory points will trigger your goal and whatever else you have programmed for your AP. So you can manually select one of those depending on how long you want the playthrough to be.

PS: It is recommended to play a new game on a save file that has already finished a play-through. (You don't have to but it will make the Band's you receive via AP items useless). Getting these Bands are checks/locations.

Some save game data if you want to pick one that has save data with a cleared playthrough to be able to get the bands in your run:
[Save Game Files](https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/gamecube/920189-fire-emblem-path-of-radiance/saves)

**CHECKS:**
Completing a story chapter give you a check.
Any units that join you rewards you with a check per unit.
Every character has a check for their available class change.
Every chest and visitable house has been organized by chapter as individual checks.
Every Item dropped by a boss or an enemy will give a check.

For clarity, when you use the manual:
Any weapon that is not listed as a receivable item is considered unlocked from the start of the game.

**IMPORTANT Clarification:** on the "Choose X character" items: This really only applies to Chapter 8 and onwards. The lack of these items in your playthrough does not impact chapters 1-7 because you don't have the option of choosing your units before you start the map. Starting chapter 8+ you will have to have those specific items to allow you to choose more units besides Ike.

Optionally you can also use Lush’s FE Universal Randomizer, “Yune”.
[Yune Randomizer](https://github.com/lushen124/Universal-FE-Randomizer/tree/master?tab=readme-ov-file#fe9)

Any suggestions/changes/feedback would be greatly appreciated!
